N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 143.4 - Applications for shift pay differentials

State Regulations

An application for a shift pay differential may be filed by
an employee, employee representative or appointing officer. Such application
shall be submitted on a form prescribed by the Director of Classification and

Compensation, which shall require, but not be limited to, the following
information: (a) The official title of
the occupation or occupations for which the differential is
requested. (b) The time of
commencement and the time of completion of the work shift to which the
application pertains and, if applicable, a delineation of the geographic area
or areas of the State for which the shift pay differential is
requested. (c) Salary and other
pertinent data of such a nature as to reasonably support the assertion that in
the area or areas to which the application pertains it is the prevailing
practice among private and other non-State employers to pay employees who work
on an equivalent shift and in an occupation which is the same as or related to
that for which the application is made a higher rate of compensation than is
paid to employees performing the same class of work during the normal day
shift. (d) The source or sources of
the salary data and facts pertaining to rates of pay, amounts of differential
pay, hours of work and other information required under this section. (e) Factual data of such a nature as to
reasonably substantiate that the duties and responsibilities of employees who
work on the shift for which the differential is sought are at least comparable
to the duties and responsibilities of employees in the same occupation who work
on the normal day shift. (f) Such
other pertinent information as may be required by the Director of

Classification and Compensation. Notes
